DOC.brief_summary: The use of laryngeal mask airway or i-gel to manage airway may improve success rates, especially in difficult situations more than tracheal intubation.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Laryngeal Mask and I-gel to Laryngoscope by Novice Operators in Simulated Difficult Airway
DOC.detailed_description: This study compares the insertion success rate and insertion time among the proceal laryngeal mask airway, i-gel, and tracheal tube. Following a short lecture, airway novices try to insert proceal laryngeal mask airway, i-gel, and tracheal tube into manikin with difficult laryngoscopy scenarios.
DOC.criteria: medical student nurse no experience of insertion using tracheal tube, igel, and laryngeal mask airway experience of insertion using tracheal tube, igel, and laryngeal mask airway
